New Records: Virat Kohli overtook Sachin Tendulkar's record for the most ODI tons
Mohammed Shami is the first India bowler to take seven wickets in an ODI
Key Match Events: Mohammed Shami took 7-57, the best figures for India in all ODIs
India posted 397-4, the highest score in a men's World Cup knockout game
Daryl Mitchell scored 134, a superb innings
Kane Williamson batted brilliantly, contributing significantly to New Zealand's innings
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
New Zealand captain Kane Williamson congratulated India and reflected on the tournament
Michael Vaughan praised India's top-order batting and the impact of Mohammed Shami
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rohit Sharma hit an unbeaten 117, his 50th ODI century
There were three incredible centuries in the match
The match was affected by swing, with the ball moving around a lot in the initial overs
